alert.note: Alert for Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 9:43PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms and heavy rain will impact portions of western Churchill and northern Lyon Counties, including Fallon, US- 50, and Highway 95 through 1045 PM PDT... At 940 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southwest of Trinity Junction to near Fort Churchill Station. Movement was east southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fallon, Lahontan Reservoir, Stillwater, Silver Springs, Fallon Municipal Airport, Junction U.S 50 And NV 116 (Stuart Rd), Us 50 At Lyon-Churchill Co Line, Junction U.S 95 And NV 120 (Pasture Rd), Battleground Point, Junction U.S 50 And NV 117 (sheckler Cutoff), Fallon Station and Lone Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
